Detailed Description

Contains functions that create ray tracing operator.

Function Documentation

dsp* mkh ( LOC_T *  locin,
LOC_T *  locout,
const double *  ampout,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale,
int  renorm 
)

Create ray tracing operator from coordinate locin to locout.

If vector Pin is defined on locin, Pout is defined on locout, H=mkh(locin, locout, ...), Pout=H*Pin does the bilinear interpolation. 

00042                    {
00043     dsp *Hb=mkhb(locin, locout, ampout,displacex, displacey, 
00044             scale, renorm);
00045     dsp *H=sptrans(Hb);
00046     spfree(Hb);
00047     return H;
00048 }

dsp* mkhb ( LOC_T *  locin,
LOC_T *  locout,
const double *  ampout,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale,
int  renorm 
)

Create the transpose of the interpolator matrix for from locin to locout.

If vector Pin is defined on locin, Pout is defined on locout, H=mkhb(locin, locout, ...), Pout=H'*Pin does the bilinear interpolation, while Pin=H*Pout does the binning (not normalized unless renorm=1). Locin is required to be evenly spaced. 

00057                     {
00058     /*
00059       renorm=1: force sum(weights) for each point to 1 even if
00060       partially illuminated. For gen of si to comply with laos.
00061      */
00062     loc_create_map_npad(locin,1);//will only do once and save in locin.
00063     dsp *hback;
00064     double dplocx, dplocy;
00065     int nplocx, nplocy, nplocx1, nplocy1;
00066     long iloc;
00067     //int missing=0;
00068     const int wrapx = locin->map->nx-1;
00069     const int wrapy = locin->map->ny-1;
00070     const double dx_in1 = 1./locin->dx;
00071     const double dx_in2 = scale*dx_in1;
00072     displacex = (displacex-locin->map->ox)*dx_in1;
00073     displacey = (displacey-locin->map->oy)*dx_in1;
00074     const double *px=locout->locx;
00075     const double *py=locout->locy;
00076 #if ONLY_FULL==1
00077     long iphi1,iphi2,iphi3,iphi4;
00078 #else
00079     long iphi;
00080 #endif
00081     //-1 because we count from 1 in the map.
00082     long (*map)[locin->map->nx]
00083     =(long(*)[locin->map->nx])(locin->map->p);
00084     long *bp,*bi;
00085     double *bx;
00086   
00087     //transpose of hfor
00088     long nzmax=locout->nloc*4;
00089     hback = spnew(locin->nloc, locout->nloc, nzmax);
00090     bp=hback->p;
00091     bi=hback->i;
00092     bx=hback->x;
00093     long count=0;
00094     double weight;
00095     //double *phiin0=phiin-1;
00096     for(iloc=0; iloc<locout->nloc; iloc++){
00097     bp[iloc]=count;//column index
00098     if(ampout && fabs(ampout[iloc])<EPS)
00099         continue;
00100     if(count+5>nzmax){
00101         nzmax*=2;
00102         spsetnzmax(hback, nzmax);
00103         bp=hback->p;
00104         bi=hback->i;
00105         bx=hback->x;
00106     }
00107     dplocy=myfma(py[iloc],dx_in2,displacey);
00108     dplocx=myfma(px[iloc],dx_in2,displacex);
00109 
00110     SPLIT(dplocx,dplocx,nplocx);
00111     SPLIT(dplocy,dplocy,nplocy);
00112 
00113     /*  if(dplocx<EPS) dplocx=0;
00114     if(1-dplocx<EPS) {
00115         nplocx++; dplocx=0;
00116     }
00117     if(dplocy<EPS) dplocy=0;
00118     if(1-dplocy<EPS) {
00119         nplocy++; dplocy=0;
00120         }*/
00121     if(nplocx<0||nplocx>=wrapx||nplocy<0||nplocy>=wrapy){
00122         continue;
00123     }
00124     nplocx1=nplocx+1;
00125     nplocy1=nplocy+1;
00126 #if ONLY_FULL == 1 //only proceed if all four points exist. preferred
00127     iphi1=map[nplocy][nplocx];
00128     iphi2=map[nplocy][nplocx1];
00129     iphi3=map[nplocy1][nplocx];
00130     iphi4=map[nplocy1][nplocx1];
00131     if(iphi1-- && iphi2-- && iphi3-- && iphi4--){
00132         if((weight=(1.-dplocx)*(1.-dplocy))>EPS){
00133         bi[count]=iphi1;
00134         bx[count]=weight;
00135         count++;
00136         }
00137         if((weight=(dplocx)*(1.-dplocy))>EPS){
00138         bi[count]=iphi2;
00139         bx[count]=weight;
00140         count++;
00141         }
00142         if((weight=(1.-dplocx)*(dplocy))>EPS){
00143         bi[count]=iphi3;
00144         bx[count]=weight;
00145         count++;
00146         }
00147         if((weight=(dplocx)*(dplocy))>EPS){
00148         bi[count]=iphi4;
00149         bx[count]=weight;
00150         count++;
00151         }
00152     }
00153 #else   
00154     if((iphi=map[nplocy][nplocx]) && (weight=(1.-dplocx)*(1.-dplocy))>EPS){
00155         bi[count]=iphi-1;
00156         bx[count]=weight;
00157         count++;
00158     }
00159     if((iphi=map[nplocy][nplocx1]) && (weight=(dplocx)*(1.-dplocy))>EPS ){
00160         bi[count]=iphi-1;
00161         bx[count]=weight;
00162         count++;
00163     }
00164     if((iphi=map[nplocy1][nplocx]) && (weight=(1.-dplocx)*(dplocy))>EPS){
00165         bi[count]=iphi-1;
00166         bx[count]=weight;
00167         count++;
00168     }
00169     if((iphi=map[nplocy1][nplocx1]) && (weight=(dplocx)*(dplocy))>EPS){
00170         bi[count]=iphi-1;
00171         bx[count]=weight;
00172         count++;
00173     }
00174 #endif
00175     if(renorm && bp[iloc]<count){
00176         double sumwt=0;
00177         for(int ic=bp[iloc]; ic<count; ic++){
00178         sumwt+=bx[ic];
00179         }
00180         if(fabs(sumwt)>EPS && fabs(sumwt-1.)>EPS){
00181         sumwt=1./sumwt;
00182         for(int ic=bp[iloc]; ic<count; ic++){
00183             bx[ic]*=sumwt;
00184         }   
00185         }
00186     }
00187     }
00188     bp[locout->nloc]=count;
00189     spclean(hback);
00190     spsetnzmax(hback, count);
00191     return hback;
00192 }

dsp* mkh_cubic ( LOC_T *  locin,
LOC_T *  locout,
const double *  ampout,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale,
double  cubic,
int  cubic_norm 
)

Create ray tracing operator from coordinate locin to locout using cubic influence function.

A cubic influence function that can reproduce piston/tip/tilt is coined by Ellerbroek to model the piezostack DM actuator. The influence has the form

where is the same as the grid spacing, and is the influence function defined in the normalized coordinates

where c is the nearest neighbor coupling frequency. The leading coefficient is to normalize the influence function so that it sums to 1. 

00215                                                     {
00216     dsp *Hb=mkhb_cubic(locin, locout, ampout,
00217               displacex, displacey, scale, cubic,
00218               cubic_norm);
00219     dsp *H=sptrans(Hb);
00220     spfree(Hb);
00221     return H;
00222 }

dsp* mkhb_cubic ( LOC_T *  locin,
LOC_T *  locout,
const double *  ampout,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale,
double  cubic,
int  cubic_norm 
)

Create back propagator matrix for from locout back to locin using cubic influence function. 

00229                                                      {
00230     loc_create_map_npad(locin,2);
00231     dsp *hback;
00232     double dplocx, dplocy;
00233     int ix,iy;
00234     int nplocx, nplocy;
00235     long iloc;
00236     int missing=0;
00237     const double dx_in1 = 1./locin->dx;
00238     const double dx_in2 = scale*dx_in1;
00239     displacex = (displacex-locin->map->ox)*dx_in1;
00240     displacey = (displacey-locin->map->oy)*dx_in1;
00241     const double *px=locout->locx;
00242     const double *py=locout->locy;
00243     long iphi;
00244     //-1 because we count from 1 in the map.
00245     long (*map)[locin->map->nx]
00246     =(long(*)[locin->map->ny])(locin->map->p);
00247     //cubic
00248     double fx[4],fy[4];
00249     const double cubicn=cubic_norm?1./(1.+2.*cubic):1.;
00250     const double c0=1*cubicn;
00251     const double c1=(4*cubic-2.5)*cubicn;
00252     const double c2=(1.5-3*cubic)*cubicn;
00253     const double c3=(2*cubic-0.5)*cubicn;
00254     const double c4=(0.5-cubic)*cubicn;
00255     double dplocx0, dplocy0;
00256     long *bp,*bi;
00257     double *bx;
00258     long nzmax=locout->nloc*16;
00259     hback = spnew(locin->nloc, locout->nloc, nzmax);
00260   
00261     bp=hback->p;
00262     bi=hback->i;
00263     bx=hback->x;
00264     long count=0;
00265     const int nmapx3=locin->map->nx-3;
00266     const int nmapy3=locin->map->ny-3;
00267     for(iloc=0; iloc<locout->nloc; iloc++){
00268     bp[iloc]=count;
00269     if(ampout && fabs(ampout[iloc])<EPS)
00270         continue;
00271     if(count+17>nzmax){
00272         nzmax*=2;
00273         spsetnzmax(hback, nzmax);
00274         bp=hback->p;
00275         bi=hback->i;
00276         bx=hback->x;
00277     }
00278 
00279     dplocy=myfma(py[iloc],dx_in2,displacey);
00280     dplocx=myfma(px[iloc],dx_in2,displacex);
00281 
00282     SPLIT(dplocx,dplocx,nplocx);
00283     SPLIT(dplocy,dplocy,nplocy);
00284     dplocy0=1.-dplocy;
00285     dplocx0=1.-dplocx;
00286 
00287     fx[0]=dplocx0*dplocx0*(c3+c4*dplocx0);
00288     fx[1]=c0+dplocx*dplocx*(c1+c2*dplocx);
00289     fx[2]=c0+dplocx0*dplocx0*(c1+c2*dplocx0);
00290     fx[3]=dplocx*dplocx*(c3+c4*dplocx);
00291         
00292     fy[0]=dplocy0*dplocy0*(c3+c4*dplocy0);
00293     fy[1]=c0+dplocy*dplocy*(c1+c2*dplocy);
00294     fy[2]=c0+dplocy0*dplocy0*(c1+c2*dplocy0);
00295     fy[3]=dplocy*dplocy*(c3+c4*dplocy); 
00296 
00297     if(nplocy<1 || nplocy>nmapy3 || nplocx<1 || nplocx>nmapx3){
00298         continue;
00299     }
00300     for(iy=nplocy-1; iy<nplocy+3; iy++){
00301         for(ix=nplocx-1; ix<nplocx+3; ix++){
00302         iphi=map[iy][ix];
00303         double weight=fx[ix-nplocx+1]*fy[iy-nplocy+1];
00304         if(iphi && weight>EPS){
00305             bi[count]=iphi-1;
00306             bx[count]=weight;
00307             count++;
00308         }
00309         }
00310     }
00311     }//for
00312     bp[locout->nloc]=count;
00313     spclean(hback);
00314     spsetnzmax(hback, count);
00315     if(missing>0){
00316     warning("%d points not covered by input screen\n", missing);
00317     }
00318     return hback;
00319 }

dsp* mkhbin1d ( dmat *  xin,
dmat *  xout 
)

Create a matrix to bin from xin to xout using bilinear interpolation.

xin and xout should be 1-d arrays of coordinates. We require the coordinates to order incrementally monotonically. 

00326                                     {
00327     if(xin->ny!=1 || xout->ny!=1){
00328     error("We require both xin and xout to be only one column\n");
00329     }
00330     int iout=0;
00331     dsp *hbin=spnew(xout->nx, xin->nx, xin->nx*2);
00332     int count=0;
00333     for(int iin=0; iin<xin->nx; iin++){
00334     hbin->p[iin]=count;
00335     double ixin=xin->p[iin];
00336     while(iout+1<xout->nx && xout->p[iout+1]<ixin){
00337         iout++;
00338     }
00339     if(xout->p[iout]>ixin || (iout+1==xout->nx && xout->p[iout]<ixin)){//outside of the area.
00340         hbin->i[count]=iout;
00341         hbin->x[count]=1;
00342         count++;
00343     }else{//within the area
00344         if(iout+1==xout->nx){
00345         error("This shouldn't happen\n");
00346         }
00347         double wt=(ixin-xout->p[iout])/(xout->p[iout+1]-xout->p[iout]);
00348         hbin->i[count]=iout;
00349         hbin->x[count]=1.-wt;
00350         count++;
00351         hbin->i[count]=iout+1;
00352         hbin->x[count]=wt;
00353         count++;
00354     }
00355     }
00356     hbin->p[xin->nx]=count;
00357     return hbin;
00358 }
